bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 65 (Monday, April 15, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. O'HALLERAN:H.R. 2328.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 18[Page H3271]

item.fullName: Del. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]
Del. Radewagen, Aumua Amata Coleman [R-AS-At Large]

item.title: H.R. 2328, Reauthorizing and Extending America’s Community Health Act
item.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Energy and Commerce on July 17, 2019

summary.text:
Community Health Investment, Modernization, and Excellence Act of 2019

This bill reauthorizes through FY2024 the Community Health Center Fund, which provides enhanced funding for community health centers and the National Health Service Corps.

Reauthorizing and Extending America’s Community Health Act or the REACH Act

This bill reauthorizes and revises various public health and Medicare programs, modifies provisions related to Medicaid, and addresses the practice of charging health insurance plan holders for the difference between a provider's rate for a service and the in-network rate.

bill.title: REACH Act

item.title: To reauthorize and extend funding for community health centers and the National Health Service Corps.
Community Health Investment, Modernization, and Excellence Act of 2019

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
